titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the UE News Photograph Collection, 1933-1998 UE.14.1
titlestmt.author: Zachary Brodt.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:13:25 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: United Electrical, Radio and Machine Workers of America

did.abstract: This collection contains photographs dating from 1933 to 1998 which were primarily used by the United Electric, Radio, and Machine Workers of America's newspaper, the UE News. These photographs document UE conventions and local functions; plant openings; international labor tours; politicians and other union presidents; and general union members. Digital reproductions of selected images are available online.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: In 1939, the UE News replaced the People's Press as the official newspaper of the United Electrical, Radio, and Machine Workers of America. The UE News is comprised of articles regarding the union, photographs of prominent UE officers and labor activities, and political cartoons. Today, the UE publishes this newspaper eight times a year.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection contains photographs dating from 1933 to 1998, the majority of which where taken between 1946 and 1989. These photographs depict many individuals who were UE members, politicians, or important to the union through there work with a company or labor relations. The majority of the photographs contained within the collection were taken in the United States of America and Canada. However, several other countries are represented, including but not limited to: Chile, El Salvador, the European Union, Guatemala, Haiti, Japan, Mexico, Nicaragua, Puerto Rico, and the Soviet Union. Such photographs involve international labor tours, conventions, plant openings, and international union establishment. Many of the photographs contain captions assigned by the newspaper editors. A selection of the images from this collection can be found online.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Photographs contained within the Convention series are arranged chronologically. District photographs are arranged numerically beginning with District 1 and ending with District 12. Districts contain locals situated by geographical areas. Locals are arranged first numerically followed by Farm Equipment and those which deviate from numerical order. Individual and Topic photographs are arranged alphabetically.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of the United Electrical, Radio, and Machine Workers of America in in several accessions dating from 1975 to the present.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: UE News Photograph Collection, 1933-1998, UE.14.1, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: UE News Photograph Collection, 1933-1998, UE.14.1, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Kristen Kos in 2005 and the finding aid was written by Zachary Brodt in January 2008.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Digital reproductions of the collection are available electronically at http://historicpittsburgh.org/collection/united-electrical-radio-machine-workers-america-ue-records.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: UE News Records, 1936-1990, UE.12, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series spans from the founding Convention in 1936 thru the 60th Convention in 1995. Files are arranged chronologically and contain some photographic negatives. Material contained within the photographs focuses on leaders and delegates addressing the convention audience.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs depicting individuals and events of specific union districts and locals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs of the founding members of the UE. Albert Fitzgerald served as the General President, Julius Emspak served as the General Secretary-Treasurer, and James Matles served as the Director of Organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs of prominent UE and non-UE individuals. Included are union officials and politicians whose actions affected the labor movement. Conference Boards, strikes, and demonstrations are also documented in this series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Chicago UE News was the official publication of UE Locals 1105, 1114, 1149, 1150, 1151, and 1154, which were located in Chicago. The newspaper was published twice per month from 1941 to 1948 and contained articles regarding the Chicago locals and UE District 11. This series contains the photograph archives of this short lived UE publication, documenting the Chicago locals' contribution to the World War II production effort and post-war labor struggles into the 1950s.
